result.execSummary:
The defendant Miles J Gloss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Response from Judge re: DVD
Defendant's Motion of Return of Property
Letter from clerk to defendant regarding Motion of Affidavit of Indigency.
Defendant's Motion of Affidavit of Indigency for Waiver of Costs/Fees

Defendant Miles J Gloss appeared by phone means from Stanley Correctional Institution. Prosecuting Atty Andrew John Maki appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:02)
On Deft's Motion to withdraw guilty plea
Mr. Maki has reviewed Motion
Court has reviewed Motion
Deft - recd letter from Sheriff's Dept that they don't have video
State - does have copy of video - thought Mr. Gloss had copy - argues deft's claim, entered plea 2 1/2 yrs ago, subsequently testified in co-deft trial - not reasonable probability of different result - can't say whether the deft recd copy of confession
Deft - argues that a different result if they had the video, they withheld the video from his defense,  defense counsel requested same video and they refused to do so - state's he lied under oath in co-deft's trial - had no choice but to take a plea because the State w/held evidence
State - it's apparent he had the video, he's quoting time stamps
Deft - he has the video now - recd it March 6, 2017 paid for the video
State - nothing in the video negates his confession - no manifest injustice
Deft - will be more then happy to send copy of education level - there is a Brady violation
State - re: Brady violation - there wasn't Brady violation

COURT:  finds upon review what would be called threats from Mr. Hakes and Bradley Erickson were made in the tactics of interrogation - it's not likely that the evidence is not evidence that would change the outcome
denies deft's motion for withdraw of plea
Court will review transcript and do written decision
Motion hearing on September 28, 2017 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Miles J Gloss, in custody, appeared with Attorney Melissa R. Peterson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Brad Erickson DOC agent in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(10:33)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - sentencing on 15CF196, 15CF274 and sentencing after revocation on 15CF49
State argues sentence on 15CF49 - 4 yrs IC 4 yrs ES - credit 310 days - rest $550.70 and surchg $55.70 requests judgment, $268 cc made judg
State argues sentence on 15CF196 Ct 1 & 15CF274 - Ct 1 6-8 yrs prison 3-4 yrs IC 3-4 yrs ES consecutive to 15CF49 $268 cc, $250 dna surchg, $10 drug surchg,  on 15CF274 3-4 yrs prison; 1-2 yrs IC and 1-2 yrs ES concurrent to 15CF196/consecutive to 15CF49, $268 cc, $250 dna surchg
submit DNA sample, pay costs, cooperate and complete AODA & mental health treatment, rest. $1,000 plus $100 surchg eligible for substance abuse not challenge incarceration
Peterson argues
Deft addresses the court

COURT:
15CF49 - Prison 8 yrs; 4 yrs IC - 4 yrs ES - forthwith
credit 310 days, restitution $611.27 remains outstanding - $518 cc required paid on extended supervision

15CF196 - 6 yrs prison; 3 yrs IC - 3 yrs ES - consecutive to 15CF49 & 15CF274
$268 cc, $250 dna surchg, $10 drug surchg - PAYMENT PLAN
zero credit
15CF274 - 4 yrs prison; 2 yrs IC - 2 yrs ES - concurrent to 15CF49 - forthwith
$268 cc, $250 dna surchg - PAYMENT PLAN
75 days credit
  CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
submit to DNA sample, pay costs & restitution, cooperate and complete AODA & after care & mental health treatment & after care
Restitution $1,000 plus $100 surchg in 15CF196
Eligible for substance abuse - not eligible for challenge incarceration - on all cases
no contact with C.P., family and her residence
loss of right to vote and carry firearm

Defendant, Miles J Gloss, in custody, appeared with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Bradley Erickson DOC agent in court (SEHR on 15CF49).  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:46)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - agreement to plea to one count of burglary 15CF196 Ct 1 & 15CF274 - dismiss remaining counts - PSI requested - doesn't have Informations done
(11:48)  break taken for DA to prepare Informations
(11:56)  back on record - INFORMATIONS FILED ON 15CF274 & 15CF196
Petersen - waives prelim hearing in 15CF274 & 15CF196
Deft - waives preliminary hearing in both files
Deft - 15CF196 Ct 1 - pleads guilty) waives rights & JT
          15CF274         - pleads guilty) waives rights & JT
Petersen - have discussed these matters with deft for a matter of months

COURT:  waiver of prelim voluntary - finds probable cause for bind overs in 15CF274 & 15CF196
pleas to 15CF196 Ct 1 and 15CF274 is found voluntary - finds deft guilty on both
***Order PSI***
13CF78 - is already done - nothing further on this
15CF49 - SEHR can be heard along with sentencing
Bonds continue
